00013 /********************************************************************
00014 ** function_map.cpp
00015 ** Author: Cody Hartwig <chartwig@cs.cmu.edu>
00016 **         Heng Yin <hyin@ece.cmu.edu> 
00017 **
00018 **
00019 ** used to map eip to function name.  this file uses the fact
00020 ** that TEMU knows module information for loaded modules.
00021 ** using this, and the print_funcs_on command, we can print
00022 ** every library call that is made within the program.
00023 **
00024 */
00025

00045 using namespace std;
00046 
00047 struct function_t {
00048   function_t(string _name, string _module, uint32_t _offset)
00049             :name(_name), module(_module), offset(_offset) 
00050   { } 
00051   function_t(){};
00052 
00053   string name;
00054   string module;
00055   uint32_t offset;
00056   operator  std::string() {
00057     return name;
00058   }
00059   operator  uint32_t() {
00060     return offset;
00061   }
00062 };
00063 
00064 /* this file supports two ways of getting function information.
00065  * the first method was to read and parse a guest.log file.
00066  * however, this seemed silly when i could just grab the information
00067  * directly.  this way we should always have the interesting information
00068  * available
00069  *
00070  * things that are removed with #if 0 represent the old way of doing things.
00071  * i hate to delete all the parsing code...
00072  */
00073 
00074 /* Maps EIP to corresponding function_t structure that includes module name, 
00075     function name and offest in module */
00076 map<uint32_t, function_t > g_function_map;
00077 
00078 /* Maps <module_name,function_name> to EIP */
00079 map <string, map <string, uint32_t > *>g_eip_map;
00080 
00081 
00082 /* Map that stores functions that need to be hooked as soon as we see the 
00083     corresponding message. Functions identified by module name and 
00084     function name */
00085 typedef pair<string, string> mod_fun_t;
00086 
00087 typedef struct {
00088   string module;
00089   string function;
00090   uint32_t hook;
00091   int is_global;
00092 }fnhook_info_t;
00093 
00094 list<fnhook_info_t> fun_to_hook;
00095 //map <string, map<string, fnhook_info_t>*> fun_to_hook;
00096 
00097 
00098 const char *function_map_search(uint32_t eip)
00099 {
00100   map< uint32_t, function_t >::iterator fmap_iter =
00101       g_function_map.find(eip);
00102   if (fmap_iter != g_function_map.end())
00103     return fmap_iter->second.name.c_str();
00104   return NULL;
00105 }
00106 
00107 struct names_t *query_name(unsigned long eip)
00108 {
00109   static names_t names;
00110   map < uint32_t, function_t >::iterator fmap_iter =
00111       g_function_map.find(eip);
00112   if (fmap_iter != g_function_map.end()) {
00113     names.fun_name = fmap_iter->second.name.c_str();
00114     names.mod_name = fmap_iter->second.module.c_str();
00115     return &names;
00116   }
00117   return NULL;
00118 }
00119 
00120 void map_to_file(const char * filename)
00121 {
00122   FILE *pFile;
00123   term_printf("Generating file: %s\n", filename);
00124   pFile = fopen(filename, "w");
00125 
00126   if (pFile) {
00127     map < uint32_t, function_t >::iterator fun_iter =
00128         g_function_map.begin();
00129     for (; fun_iter != g_function_map.end(); fun_iter++) {
00130       fprintf(pFile, "0x%08x %s %s 0x%04x\n",
00131               fun_iter->first,
00132               fun_iter->second.module.c_str(),
00133               fun_iter->second.name.c_str(), fun_iter->second.offset);
00134     }
00135 
00136     fclose(pFile);
00137   }
00138 }

00140 
00141 void add_fun_to_hook(const char *module_name,
00142                      const char *function_name, 
00143                      uint32_t hookfn,
00144                      int is_global)
00145 {
00146   fnhook_info_t info;
00147   info.module = module_name;
00148   info.function = function_name;
00149   info.hook = hookfn;
00150   info.is_global = is_global;
00151   fun_to_hook.push_back(info);
00152 }
00153 
00154 static void 
00155 resolve_fun_to_hook(const char *module, const char *function, uint32_t eip)
00156 {
00157   list<fnhook_info_t>::iterator iter;
00158   for(iter=fun_to_hook.begin(); iter!=fun_to_hook.end(); iter++) {
00159     if(strcasecmp(iter->module.c_str(), module) ||
00160       strcasecmp(iter->function.c_str(), function)) 
00161       continue;
00162 
00163     hookapi_hook_function(iter->is_global, eip, (hook_proc_t)iter->hook, 
00164         NULL, 0);
00165     term_printf("Hooking %s::%s @ 0x%x with 0x%x\n", module, function, eip,
00166                iter->hook);
00167     iter = fun_to_hook.erase(iter);
00168     iter--;
00169   }
00170 }

00172 #if 0
00173 uint32_t remove_fun_to_hook(const char *module_name,
00174                             const char *function_name)
00175 {
00176   map<string, map<string, uint32_t > *>::iterator iter1 =
00177       fun_to_hook.find(module_name);
00178 
00179   if (iter1 == fun_to_hook.end())
00180     return 0;
00181 
00182   map<string, uint32_t >::iterator iter2 =
00183       iter1->second->find(function_name);
00184 
00185   if (iter2 == iter1->second->end())
00186     return 0;
00187 
00188   uint32_t hookfn = iter2->second;
00189 
00190   // Found function, remove it and check if need to remove module
00191   iter1->second->erase(iter2);
00192   if (iter1->second->size() == 0)
00193     fun_to_hook.erase(iter1);
00194 
00195   return hookfn;
00196 }
00197 
00198 int query_fun_to_hook(const char *module_name,
00199                       const char *function_name)
00200 {
00201   map <string, map <string, uint32_t > *>::iterator iter1 =
00202       fun_to_hook.find(module_name);
00203 
00204   if (iter1 == fun_to_hook.end())
00205     return 0;
00206 
00207   map <string, uint32_t >::iterator iter2 =
00208       iter1->second->find(function_name);
00209 
00210   if (iter2 == iter1->second->end())
00211     return 0;
00212 
00213   return 1;
00214 }
00215 #endif
00216 
00217 uint32_t query_eip(const char *module_name, const char *function_name)
00218 {
00219   map<string, map<string, uint32_t > *>::iterator iter1 =
00220       g_eip_map.find(string(module_name));
00221 
00222   if (iter1 == g_eip_map.end())
00223     return 0;
00224 
00225   map <string, uint32_t >::iterator iter2 =
00226       iter1->second->find(string(function_name));
00227 
00228   if (iter2 == iter1->second->end())
00229     return 0;
00230 
00231   return iter2->second;
00232 }

00235 
00236 static void
00237 add_rev_lookup(const char *module_name, const char *function_name, uint32_t eip)
00238 {
00239   map<string, map <string, uint32_t > *>::iterator iter1 =
00240       g_eip_map.find(module_name);
00241 
00242   map<string, uint32_t > *inner_map = NULL;
00243 
00244   if (iter1 == g_eip_map.end()) {
00245     inner_map = new map <string, uint32_t >;
00246     g_eip_map[module_name] = inner_map;
00247   }
00248   else {
00249     inner_map = iter1->second;
00250   }
00251 
00252   map<string, uint32_t >::iterator iter2 = inner_map->find(function_name);
00253 
00254   if (iter2 == inner_map->end()) {
00255     (*inner_map)[function_name] = eip;
00256   }
00257 }
00258 
00259 /* g_function_map */
00260 void handle_message(char *message)
00261 {
00262   static map<string, vector<function_t> *>orphan_funcs;
00263   static map<string, uint32_t > module_map;
00264 
00265   if (message[0] == 'F') {
00266     char module[512];
00267     char fname[512];
00268     uint32_t offset;
00269 
00270     if (sscanf(message, " F %s %s %x ", module, fname, &offset) != 3)
00271       return;
00272 
00273     map<string, uint32_t >::iterator module_map_it =
00274         module_map.find(module);
00275 
00276     if (module_map_it == module_map.end()) {
00277       /* we have an orphan function */
00278       function_t func((string)fname, (string)module, offset);
00279       map<string, vector<function_t> *>::iterator it =
00280           orphan_funcs.find(module);
00281 
00282       if (it == orphan_funcs.end()) {
00283         orphan_funcs[module] = new vector<function_t>;
00284       }
00285       orphan_funcs[module]->push_back(func);
00286     }
00287     else {
00288       /* we have a function that is associated with a known module */
00289       uint32_t base = module_map_it->second;
00290       uint32_t entry = base + offset;
00291 
00292       function_t func((string)fname, (string)module, offset);
00293       g_function_map[entry] = func;
00294 
00295       /* insert reverse lookup */
00296       add_rev_lookup(module, fname, entry);
00297 
00298       resolve_fun_to_hook(module, fname, entry);
00299     }
00300   }
00301   else if (message[0] == 'M') {
00302     uint32_t blah1, blah2;
00303     char module[512];
00304     uint32_t base;
00305 
00306     //We try to parse a long name with spaces first. If failed, we parse in the old way, 
00307     //for backward compatibility. -Heng
00308     if (sscanf(message, "M %d %x \"%[^\"]\" %x ", &blah1, &blah2, module, &base) < 4) {
00309       if (sscanf(message, "M %x %x %s %x ", &blah1, &blah2, module, &base) < 4)
00310       return;
00311     }
00312 
00313     module_map.insert(std::pair < std::string, uint32_t > (module, base));
00314 
00315     /* look for orphan functions */
00316     std::map < std::string, std::vector < function_t > *>::iterator it =
00317         orphan_funcs.find(module);
00318     if (it == orphan_funcs.end())
00319       return;
00320 
00321     std::vector < function_t > *pf = it->second;
00322 
00323     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < pf->size(); ++i) {
00324       uint32_t eip = (*pf)[i].offset + base;
00325       g_function_map.insert(std::pair < uint32_t,
00326                             function_t > (eip, (*pf)[i]));
00327       /*
00328        ** LOG("fcn_load", "Adding %s @ %08x+%x\n", (*pf)[i].name.c_str(),
00329        **     base, (*pf)[i].offset);
00330        */
00331 
00332       /* insert reverse lookup */
00333       add_rev_lookup((*pf)[i].module.c_str(), (*pf)[i].name.c_str(), eip);
00334 
00335       resolve_fun_to_hook((*pf)[i].module.c_str(), (*pf)[i].name.c_str(), eip);
00336     }
00337 
00338     delete pf;
00339 
00340     orphan_funcs.erase(it);
00341 
00342   }
00343   else {
00344     /* empty: unsupported message */
00345   }
00346 }
00347 
00348 
00349 /* Serialize function information by creating module/function messages 
00350     Writes a maximum of buf_size bytes into buf 
00351     Returns the number of bytes written into buf
00352 */
00353 static int serialize_maps(char *buf, int buf_size)
00354 {
00355   std::map < std::string, uint32_t > module_map;
00356 
00357   char *first_empty_pos = buf;
00358   int remaining_size = buf_size;
00359   char msg_buf[512] = "";
00360   int num_bytes = 0;
00361   uint32_t base = 0;
00362 
00363   /* Iterate over function map */
00364   map < uint32_t, function_t >::iterator fun_iter = g_function_map.begin();
00365   for (; fun_iter != g_function_map.end(); fun_iter++) {
00366 
00367     /* Check if the module has already been seen */
00368     std::map < std::string, uint32_t >::iterator module_map_it =
00369         module_map.find(fun_iter->second.module.c_str());
00370 
00371     /* If module has never been seen, add it and create message */
00372     if (module_map_it == module_map.end()) {
00373       base = fun_iter->first - fun_iter->second.offset;
00374       module_map.insert(std::pair < std::string, uint32_t >
00375                         (fun_iter->second.module.c_str(), base));
00376 
00377       num_bytes = snprintf(msg_buf, 512,
00378                            "M %x %x %s %x&", 0, 0,
00379                            fun_iter->second.module.c_str(), base);
00380       if (num_bytes > 512)
00381         num_bytes = 512;
00382       // msg_buf should not be null-terminated
00383 
00384       if (num_bytes <= remaining_size) {
00385         strncpy(first_empty_pos, msg_buf, num_bytes);
00386         first_empty_pos += num_bytes;
00387         remaining_size -= num_bytes;
00388       }
00389       else
00390         break;
00391     }
00392 
00393     /* Create function message */
00394     num_bytes = snprintf(msg_buf, 512,
00395                          "F %s %s %x&",
00396                          fun_iter->second.module.c_str(),
00397                          fun_iter->second.name.c_str(),
00398                          fun_iter->second.offset);
00399     if (num_bytes > 512)
00400       num_bytes = 512;
00401     // msg_buf should not be null-terminated
00402 
00403     if (num_bytes <= remaining_size) {
00404       strncpy(first_empty_pos, msg_buf, num_bytes);
00405       first_empty_pos += num_bytes;
00406       remaining_size -= num_bytes;
00407     }
00408     else
00409       break;
00410 
00411   }
00412 
00413   return buf_size - remaining_size;
00414 
00415 }
00416 
00417 /* Unserialize function information by calling handle_message */
00418 static void unserialize_maps(const char *buf, int buf_size)
00419 {
00420   char *msg = NULL;
00421   const char *delim = "&";
00422 
00423   char *parsing_buf = (char *) malloc(buf_size + 1);
00424   strncpy(parsing_buf, buf, buf_size);
00425   parsing_buf[buf_size] = '\0';
00426 
00427   /* Get first message */
00428   msg = strtok(parsing_buf, delim);
00429   if (msg) {
00430     handle_message(msg);
00431 
00432     /* Get remaining messages */
00433     while ((msg = strtok(NULL, delim)) != NULL) {
00434       handle_message(msg);
00435     }
00436   }
00437 
00438 }
00439 
00440 static void function_map_save(QEMUFile * f, void *opaque)
00441 {
00442   char buf[5 * 1024 * 1024];
00443   uint32_t len = serialize_maps(buf, sizeof(buf));
00444   assert(len < sizeof(buf));
00445 
00446   TEMU_CompressState_t state;
00447   uint32_t ending = 0;
00448   if (TEMU_compress_open(&state, f) < 0)
00449     return;
00450 
00451   //FIXME: need to save maps too.
00452 
00453   qemu_put_be32(f, len);
00454   TEMU_compress_buf(&state, (uint8_t *) buf, len);
00455   TEMU_compress_buf(&state, (uint8_t *) & ending, 4);   //ending
00456   TEMU_compress_close(&state);
00457 }
00458 
00459 static int function_map_load(QEMUFile * f, void *opaque, int version_id)
00460 {
00461   char buf[5 * 1024 * 1024];
00462   uint32_t len = qemu_get_be32(f);
00463   uint32_t ending;
00464 
00465   //FIXME: need to load maps too.
00466 
00467   if (len >= sizeof(buf))
00468     return -EINVAL;
00469 
00470   TEMU_CompressState_t state;
00471   if (TEMU_decompress_open(&state, f) < 0)
00472     return -EINVAL;
00473 
00474   TEMU_decompress_buf(&state, (uint8_t *) buf, len);
00475   TEMU_decompress_buf(&state, (uint8_t *) & ending, 4);
00476   if (ending != 0)
00477     return -EINVAL;
00478 
00479   unserialize_maps(buf, len);
00480   return 0;
00481 }
00482 
00483 
00484 void function_map_init()
00485 {
00486   register_savevm("funmap", 0, 1, function_map_save, function_map_load,
00487                   NULL);
00488 }
00489 
00490 void function_map_cleanup()
00491 {
00492   g_function_map.clear();
00493   map<string, map <string, uint32_t > *>::iterator g_eip_iter =
00494     g_eip_map.begin();
00495   for (; g_eip_iter != g_eip_map.end(); g_eip_iter++) {
00496     map<string, uint32_t > *inner_map = g_eip_iter->second;
00497     if (inner_map != NULL) {
00498       (*inner_map).clear();
00499       delete inner_map;
00500       inner_map = NULL;
00501     }
00502   }
00503   g_eip_map.clear();
00504   fun_to_hook.clear();
00505   deregister_savevm("funmap", 0);
00506 }
